frameDefinitions: This frame describes intentionally formed human social groups (here termed Organizations) with some definite structure and Members.
A New_member becomes a member of a socially-constructed Group.
An Agent performs a series of unspecified tasks to plan for an Event to take place at a Scheduled_time and Place.
These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity  or group (the Governed) or an Activity.
An Agent schedules an Event to take place at a specified Scheduled_time and Place.
An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved. '' 'At the same time, city-states began to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.'
frameExamples: Seven new members and the three countries <t>joined</t> the alliance five years ago.
I've <t>arranged</t> a breakfast meeting for you tomorrow morning with Mr. Huntsberger.
Sebek em hat was a <t>Leader</t> of Priests. ca. 1780 BC
Gina <t>scheduled</t> a dentist appointment for Monday in Berkeley.
At the same time, city-states <t>began</t> to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity of which the individuals are <fen>Members</fen>.
A person belonging to an <fen>Organization</fen>.
This role describes the general location where the <fen>Organization</fen> operates, but does not indicate the possessor of the <fen>Organization</fen>.
The <fen>New_member</fen> becomes a member of a (socially-defined) <fen>Group</fen>.
The <fen>Group</fen> is a socially-constructed entity composed of members.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>New_member</fen> joins the <fen>Group</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the joining occurs.
The person who makes arrangements for the <fen>Event</fen> to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The incident for which the <fen>Agent</fen> has made arrangements.
The time for which the <fen>Agent</fen> has arranged the <fen>Event</fen>.
This role describes the time at which the arrangements are made.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> has made arrangements for the <fen>Event</fen> to take place.

The <fen>Leader</fen> is the one who has the role of leading.  With verbs, and with predicate nominals linking an individual to a <fen>Role</fen>, the <fen>Leader</fen> is usually the External Argument:

The role played by the <fen>Leader</fen> in a given situation, often an official title; incorporated in most noun LUsin this frame. When expressed separately from the target, <fen>Role</fen> usually occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>as</ment>.
The entity whose actions or beliefs the <fen>Leader</fen> directs in the context of a joint activity or movement.  This entity can be a political body, a person, or a group of people.
The <fen>Leader</fen> directs the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> refers to the point in time that the leadership took place.
The locale from which the <fen>Leader</fen> leads the <fen>Governed</fen> or the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The sentient being who schedules an <fen>Event</fen> to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The incident that the <fen>Agent</fen> has scheduled to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Event</fen> is scheduled to take place.
This role describes the time at which the scheduling occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> has scheduled the <fen>Event</fen> to take place.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that an <fen>Agent</fen> starts.
This role identifies the being that starts the intentional <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Have <fex>you</fex> signed up for the new Medicare Prescription program?
An avid skier myself, I ventured to Aspen and enrolled in Nevin's school <fex>last winter</fex> to see what all the fuss was about.
<fex>Lucy</fex> organized a playdate for little Michael and Marcy.
Lionel organized a meeting <fex>at the local pub</fex> to discuss the bleak future of our organization.
The general led his troops into battle <fex>on June 22, 1883</fex>.
He ruled the west <fex>from his palace in Milan</fex>.
<fex>I</fex> set up a meeting with Carlos on Monday.
I'd like to set up <fex>a meeting with Mr. Hofmann</fex>.
Gina scheduled a dentist appointment for Monday <fex>in Berkeley</fex>.
